intro: Xanthocromyon, commonly known as the golden-stemmed aster, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the late summer and early autumn. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Xanthocromyon is often found in meadows and along woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
